body_html:
The issue is with the LSTM output. In tf.keras/backend.py, at the end of the call to rnn, we need to call .set_shape(shape) on the outputs, with a shape that's basically (inputs.get_shape[0], inputs.get_shape[1], None) (batch dim and time dim -- no need to specify the feature dim since it's already correctly inferred).

Feel free to open a PR.

body:
The issue is with the LSTM output. In `tf.keras/backend.py`, at the end of the call to `rnn`, we need to call `.set_shape(shape)` on the outputs, with a shape that's basically `(inputs.get_shape[0], inputs.get_shape[1], None)` (batch dim and time dim -- no need to specify the feature dim since it's already correctly inferred).

Feel free to open a PR.
